synopsis.p: Runs a Python script. This module is useful for processing the corpus with Python libraries dedicated to NLP.

description.p: assumes the script reads from standard input the AlvisNLP data structure serialized as JSON. also assumes the script writes the modifications serialized in JSON to the standard output.
The alvisnlp.py library facilitates the deserialization, serialization, and manipulation of the AlvisNLP data structure. It is located in the directory specified by alvisnlpPythonDirectory.
The script to run is specified with script.

param-doc.name: callPython
param-doc.p: Either to call Python interpreter as executable and the script as the command. If this parameter is false, then the user must have execution rights on the script, and the script must have the appropriate shebang to locate the Python interpreter.

param-doc.name: commandLine
param-doc.p: Additional command line arguments to pass to the script.

param-doc.name: layerNames
param-doc.p: Names of layers to serialize. Layers not mentioned in this parameter will not be serialized. Use this to limit the amount of serialized data. By default serializes all annotations in all layers.

param-doc.name: relations
param-doc.p: Names of relations to serialize. Relations not mentioned in this parameter will not be serialized. Use this to limit the amount of serialized data. By default serializes all tuples in all relations.

param-doc.name: script
param-doc.p: Path to the script to run.

param-doc.name: scriptParams
param-doc.p: Parameters to pass through the the serialized data structure. Expressions are evaluated from the corpus as strings.
